posts.author: Aquarius 233
posts.content:
Introductions are always difficult for new posts, so I will make it short :)
As I have in my list some modules to play that make you reach lv 20, I decided to start thinking of an elf archer: I will play it when I will finish my first and second playthrough of WoG (with a spellsword).

Thinking about ways to avoid EXP penalty but using a pure elf (DEX build), I came up with this build. Having not found similar builds in the lv 20 pre-epic characters guild nor in this one (hope that I have not missed anything), I'll post it here for your comments and suggestions:

20: Concentration(10), Spellcraft(11)


I chose not to take empower spell, due to the fact that lv 4 slots (for empowered lv 2 buffs) should be already full (so many useful spells....).

Advantages:
  • Cleric buffs (many of these are +3, as 9th level is reached) and defensive spells will help for both ranged and melee battles (extended divine power: with strenght domain, I feel there is much more flexibility);
  • High ranged AB;
  • Strong Will save;
  • High WIS means also bonus spell slots and a good DC for cleric offensive spells (Hammer of the gods, yeah, I'm thinking of you);
  • No need for uncanny dodge (my nightmare for DEX builds);
  • Full-plate brings much AC;
  • Trickery domain (improved invisibility) helps avoiding melee attacks;
  • Trickery domain can be replaced with plant, so there is a space free for a periapt of wisdom (if +4, 2 lv 4 slots can be obtained) due to barkskin (+3 Natural AC);
Disadvantages (hope that you can help me avoid the first):
  • Divine power not granting the extra attack at full-BAB (due to the high levels of AA);
  • No rapid shot;
  • Low STR means easy encumbrance (particularly if full plate is equipped: she/she will need to cast bull's strenght or find +STR items);
  • Dispellable buffs at high levels (correct me if I am wrong).

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: Knockdown is much less beneficial for an archer.  Unlike a melee weapon, knocking down an opponent actually makes it harder to hit with a ranged weapon, but you do still have the benefit of an enemy being unable to do anything while prone.  Dropping Knockdown would give you an opportunity to get Rapid Shot after all.

posts.author: Aquarius 233
posts.content:
Thank you for your advices!

I decided to take knockdown to face wizards, as in high levels they tend to cast time stop and gain some turns over the fighter...however, I understand that if I don't have enough strenght, he/she will have the time to recover and, maybe, counterattack.
However, I think you're right. Should it be much more useful to take called shot at lv 12 and, at 18, the improved critical feat (as an example).

For called shot: that feat save my live playing AL modules series. I didn't finish them, but I clearly remember that I defeated a drow priestess who was buffing, by spamming leg shots. She couldn't move almost at all and I was completely surprised by the power of this feat; hence, even if I know I don't make the most of it (as I don't have enough expertise and knowledge), I could be very happy to take it in earlier levels (at level 9, or first).
Cleric 10/Wizard 1/AA 9 is an interesting option to me as it would help for buff duration, as you already outlined (I took wiz even level only for the +1 to will save), but I won't reduce AA levels as I want to penetrate Premonition.

For Cl17/R3, which is the power underneath such combination? I can only see taking a free greater spell focus feat...

Mick, I understand what you mean by saying: "Even if your Tumble is cross classed, the dexterity and light armor will help you reach 15 to avoid AOO  when moving.", but, honestly, didn't thought of it. That means, if you know you will have a low AC (or a lower AC, considering environment and enemies), you have to face the threath by escaping attacks through movements.
This is a true option, considering that it grants rapid shot.
Reading through NWN Wiki, it would seem possible to delay the extend spell feat to arcane archer levels, but it would be too late...

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content: I'm certainly not about to tread on Mick's toes as far as AAs go (he wrote the Guide, after all), but if you really want the AA power, Zen Archery doesn't bring the AA bonuses with it, so it's worth asking whether you want a decent all-rounder or a specialist archer?

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Aquarius 233 wrote:
For Cl17/R3, which is the power underneath such combination? I can only see taking a free greater spell focus feat...
Cleric 15+ allows for all your buffs to be +5 instead.

Your build, with only 9 Cleric levels would have all the buffs ending in +3 bonus.

Examples are: Divine Favour, Greater Magic Weapon, Shield of Faith, Magic Vestment, etc.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
It is well known that 15 Cleric levels maxes out all the +1/ 3 levels spells at +5.
AA on the other hand adds +1 enhancement/ 2 levels, giving +5 enhancement at 9 AA levels. That means +5 AB, +5 damage and that even a mundane bow pierces Stoneskins and Premonition.
We are talking about two of the most powerful classes in NWN here.
If you want a Cleric archer, I think that the Cleric 10/ AA 9 split is the best.

Now, a pure (or almost pure) Cleric will often make a better archer than a pure Ranger, and a pure level 20 Cleric with all its spell power can only be matched by a dedicated arcane mage. But then again, an AA is the best mage killer, only contested by the Monk class.
This may look like a Rock-Paper-Scissors scenario, and in a way it is.

But if it is a level 20 archer you want, I say AA 9 (or 10) every time.
